headline: Trump says Friday tariff deadline 'will not be extended'
summary: President Donald Trump said that he will not extend the deadline for his "reciprocal" tariffs on dozens of countries to restart.

headline: Jim Cramer says earnings misses at these 3 companies show Trump tariffs are hitting consumers
summary: CNBC’s Jim Cramer warned that Trump tariffs are starting to hurt consumers after UPS, Whirlpool, and Stanley Black & Decker reported "jarring quarters."

headline: Trump’s 50% tariff on copper imports is set to start Friday. Here’s what could happen.
summary: The U.S. is expected to implement a 50% tariff on copper imports at the end of the week, but what happens next is anyone’s guess as talk of an exemption for Chile, the biggest U.S. supplier of the metal, and a potential U.S. and European “metal alliance” heats up.
